intro: Xanthophytum brookei, commonly known as the golden brooke's plant, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves that store water, adapting it to its arid environment. The plant belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, which includes many species with similar adaptations. Xanthophytum brookei typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in high-altitude regions. Its unique appearance and ecological adaptations make it a notable species in its native habitat.
